title: Drawing, "Plate Design:  Sucre de Canne [Sugar Cane] from the Service des Objets de Dessert [Dessert Service]", 1819–20
title_raw: Plate Design:  Sucre de Canne [Sugar Cane] from the Service des Objets de Dessert [Dessert Service]
medium: Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, white gouache, red crayon, graphite on pink/tan paper mounted on blue/gray paper
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite on mount, lower center:  Sucre de canne
provenance:
Collection H.N.
Spencer Samuels, New York
description: Scene in a sugar shop.  A black man, center, points to a large picture on the right wall depicting people working in a sugar cane field.  He is explaining the scene to a young boy and girl.  He holds an axe in his right hand to cut a piece of sugar cane in a dish placed on a table in front of him.  A young boy, left foreground, seated at the table is tasting a piece of sugar cane.  Another boy seated opposite him is processing sugar [?].  A cupboard, left rear ground, holds large pieces of sugar cane.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Plate Design:  Sucre de Canne [Sugar Cane] from the Service des Objets de Dessert [Dessert Service]", 1819–20. Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, white gouache, red crayon, graphite on pink/tan paper mounted on blue/gray paper. 1989-13-8.
